column4: hello I am trying to resize my disk as I am running out of space on / - I downloaded gparted but that does not allow me to resize even though I have free space
you mustn't resize / when running. Boot from a live cd
i am running off the gparted cd
oh ok. did gparted resized the other partition? (That you are trying to get some space from.)
yes - but when I try to resize /dev/sda1, does not show the free space
check if 'df' and 'parted' show diffent sizes of /. for additional info: 'man df' and 'man parted'
is the same
hm strage. That was what i encountered when resizing a partition. and the other partition is smaller in size?
no - much bigger - does that make a difference? and I have ext4 on all
but didn't you tryed to make the other one smaller to "give" the space to your root dir?
oh yes sorry - misunderstood - yes I did
so where's the space gone? check again with parted
its under "extended"
ok then try with gparted to make extended smaller. any ideas why the free space has gone to extended?
http://pastebin.com/deabf5c
I think its because I mounted /home on its own partition
why do partition 3 and 5 both start @ 10gig?
/home starts on that
sorry no idea
me too!
thanks tho
not at all
